decks.notes: This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Ephemerate. The key strategy of this deck is to utilize powerful creatures like Phelia and Phlage to deal damage quickly, while also using control elements like Consign to Memory and Quantum Riddler to gain an advantage. The deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain control of the game through a mix of aggression and disruption, ultimately overwhelming the opponent before they can stabilize.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It relies on building a board presence with versatile creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, while utilizing powerful burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to finish off opponents. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Blood Moon and Mana Tithe, as well as card advantage with Seasoned Pyromancer and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. Its key strength lies in its ability to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Allosaurus Combo, which involves using creatures like Allosaurus Rider and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant to exploit the free spells from Neoform and Eldritch Evolution to bring out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Ureni, the Song Unending. Generous Ent provides additional resources while Pact of Negation offers protection. Consign to Memory helps manipulate library and graveyard. This combo-centric deck aims to outpace and overwhelm opponents with its explosive plays and versatile options.

The deck focuses on aggressive creature plays while disrupting the opponent's strategy through targeted removal and hand disruption. By utilizing cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to control the board and tempo of the game. Cards like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate provide additional value through blinking creatures and triggering enter-the-battlefield effects multiple times. The deck aims to pressure the opponent while maintaining control of the game state, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of aggressive plays and disruption.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells to control the board. It utilizes a diverse range of creatures and spells across multiple colors to apply pressure from different angles and maintain tempo. By combining aggro strategies with versatile removal and disruption, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game. The key is to efficiently deploy threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately securing victory through relentless aggression and strategic decision-making.

The deck aims to create a powerful combo using cards like Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker to generate a large amount of creatures, which can then be pumped up with Blade of the Bloodchief to deal massive amounts of damage. The Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End provide additional late-game threats. The deck also utilizes cards like Urza's Saga and Ancient Stirrings to search for key pieces of the combo, while disruption cards like Kozilek's Command help to control the opponent's board state. Overall, the deck focuses on assembling its combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board presence.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, and then using spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to bring them back onto the battlefield for a powerful combo finish. Thoughtseize and Force of Negation provide disruption to protect the combo, while Faithful Mending allows for card draw and graveyard manipulation. The deck is able to quickly reanimate creatures while controlling the game with removal spells and counters, creating a strong and versatile strategy in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost artifacts and using them to generate mana efficiency, allowing the player to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and versatility. Key cards like Arcbound Ravager, Mox Opal, and Urza's Saga enable explosive gameplay while Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Thoughtcast provide card advantage and consistency. Engineered Explosives and Weapons Manufacturing help control the board while Pithing Needle and Tormod's Crypt disrupt enemy strategies. The deck aims to outpace the opponent and apply pressure through a combination of artifact creatures and powerful spells.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to utilize cheap and efficient creatures and spells to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. By combining aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channel with powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent while maintaining card advantage through cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration. The inclusion of Mutagenic Growth and Unholy Heat allows for additional flexibility and removal options in order to gain the upper hand in the match.

This deck revolves around assembling a combo involving artifacts and legendary creatures to generate mana and draw cards, ultimately leading to a win condition that involves milling the opponent's library or creating infinite loops for victory. Utilizing cards like Grinding Station, Mishra's Bauble, and Kethis, the Hidden Hand, the deck aims to control the game while setting up its win condition. Jace, the Perfected Mind and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide card advantage and protection, while Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga help with recursion and searching for key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to create a powerful engine that can overwhelm the opponent and secure a win through its combo interactions.

The deck focuses on generating a high amount of mana quickly and efficiently using rituals and mana generators like Pyretic Ritual and Ruby Medallion. It also includes card draw and selection with cards like Reckless Impulse and Wish to find combo pieces. The win condition is to cast spells multiple times in a single turn using Ral, Monsoon Mage's ability and Past in Flames, while also utilizing storm spells like Glimpse the Impossible and Flame of Anor to overwhelm the opponent. The deck aims to create explosive turns and win the game in one big combo.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also utilizing efficient removal spells like Fatal Push. The deck also includes early threats like Orcish Bowmasters and Nethergoyf, as well as powerful finishers like Emperor of Bones and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck can further disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Pithing Needle and Nihil Spellbomb. The inclusion of Urza's Saga provides additional value and consistency to the deck, while Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth ensures mana efficiency.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful creatures and disrupting your opponent's game plan with disruptive spells. The deck aims to pressure the opponent by playing aggressive threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, while using cards like Solitude and Prismatic Ending to remove key threats. Teferi, Time Raveler helps control the tempo of the game, allowing you to play your spells while preventing your opponent from doing the same. Consign to Memory and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide card advantage and help maintain board presence, while Quantum Riddler and Arena of Glory offer additional support and utility.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, while also using powerful cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to maintain pressure. The deck also includes control elements like Goblin Bombardment and Thraben Charm to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, cards like Arena of Glory and Voice of Victory provide additional support for the aggressive strategy. The deck aims to quickly close out games by combining speed and versatility.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana with cards like Ruby Medallion and rituals, then utilizing Ral, Monsoon Mage and Glimpse the Impossible to draw cards and produce even more mana. The goal is to cast a high storm count spell such as Grapeshot to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes ways to recast spells from the graveyard with Past in Flames and Wish, allowing for explosive combo turns. It aims to assemble the combo pieces quickly and win the game before the opponent can react.

This deck focuses on aggressive strategies, utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco to quickly pressure the opponent. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provide additional support by controlling the board and protecting your creatures. Consign to Memory and Teferi, Time Raveler offer card advantage and disruption, while Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial provide additional removal and protection. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan, with a mix of fetch lands and shock lands to ensure consistent color access.
